title: 18xx Maker
about: 18xx Maker can take 18xx game definitions written in json, display them, and render them for printing. The original intent of this site was for personal PnP projects, but the purpose has shifted over time to prototyping new games.
piracy: Do not use this app to print games that you don't have a license to print. Please support our 18xx designers, developers, and publishers.

refresh.description: Reload the latest version of this file

prototype.description: This game is still being developed

wip.description: This game might not be complete or accurate

export.singlePdf: Export this component as a pdf document
export.singlePng: Export this component as a png image

config.what: The app stores information that it needs to function in a config file on your local computer. This file stores information about local files you've edited using the app, the list of recent files you've edited as well as the last page you've used so we can return to it next time we launch the app.
config.file: Your configuration file is located here:

updates.title: Updates
updates.error: No updates found. Latest version unknown.
updates.dev: Updates are disabled in dev mode.
updates.latest: No updates found. {{version}} is the latest version!

die.title: Die Cutter
die.description: Info about the Ellison die cutter

page.description: This page shows all of the generic tiles that 18xx Maker knows about.

atoms.title: Map Elements
atoms.description: Basic atoms for maps and tiles

page.description: This page shows examples of all items that you can display on either map hexes or tiles. Use these examples to help prototype your game!
Here are all of the SVG logos bundled with 18xx Maker.

games.title: Games
games.description: These are the games that you have loaded into 18xx Maker

started.title: Getting Started
started.description: If you want to jump right in to printing an existing game or creating a new one, check out our <started>Getting Started</started> page to get up and running fast.

discord.title: Discord
discord.description: We have a <discord>discord for 18xx-Maker</discord>. Please use it for any development chat or support!

gtg.title: Partnership with Grand Trunk Games
gtg.description: <gtg>Grand Trunk Games</gtg> is a great publisher and a big supporter of print and play. They have decided to make all of their games available on 18xx Maker as the official print and play provider! If you are able to we highly recommend supporting this publisher by purchasing their excellent productions of 1861/67 and Shikoku 1889!

app.title: The 18xx Maker Application
app.description: We have a version of <app>18xx Maker bundled as a desktop application</app>. The interface is the same but there is better support for file editing and more exporting options. If you are working on prototyping your own game we highly recommend you download the app.

credits.title: Credits
credits.description: The code is available on GitHub. We use GitHub actions, releases, and packages to handle CI, app hosting, and docker image hosting. We use Netlify to build and serve the website and the storybook.

license.title: License
license.description: The code of this project is licensed under the <license>MIT License</license> but the games contained within are not covered by this. The games are presented with no license from 18xx Maker with the permission of the publishers and/or designers.
license.permission: All games included in this repository are included with permission from the publisher and/or designer. You can make print and play copies for your own personal use. Please thank them for their support of Print and Play! If you need to inquire about the license for a game you should contact the publisher and/or designer.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: 18xx Maker uses a self hosted version of <plausible>Plausible</plausible> to gather some analytics. No personal data is gathered and no data is gathered about what games or files you are using and editing. The only purpose is to to know how users are accessing 18xx Maker and what features are being used so we can better focus our efforts.

donations.title: Donations
donations.description: I've been asked about donation buttons; if you find this software useful to you and would like to donate money towards its development you can do so via <paypal>Paypal</paypal>, <cash>Square Cash</cash>, or <venmo>Venmo</venmo>.
